brief_summary.textblock:
This study is conducted in the United States of America (USA). The aim of the study is to
      assess the impact of pain on functional impairment and quality of life in adult persons with
      hemophilia (PWH) with and without inhibitors with joint bleeding.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Pain on Functional Impairment and Quality of Life in Adults With Hemophilia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult males able to provide consent and complete a survey in English

          -  Congenital hemophilia A or B with or without inhibitors with any history of joint
             bleeding or joint pain

          -  Presentation at the treatment center for a comprehensive annual visit where joint
             range of motion will be obtained

          -  Informed consent obtained before any study-related activities. (Study-related
             activities are any procedure related to recording of data according to the protocol)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous participation in this study

study_pop.textblock:
Consecutive adult PWH in the United States of America (USA) willing to consent to
        participation who have any history of joint bleeding or joint pain presenting for a
        comprehensive care visit during which joint range of motion will be assessed.

intervention.description: Subject will only fill out a questionnaire

facility.name: Novo Nordisk Clinical Trial Call Center

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Pain on Functional Impairment and Quality of Life in Adults With Hemophilia

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the first visit (only one study visit)
At the first visit (only one study visit)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
